verses.verse: The <S%H4853>burden<s%> of <S%H6865>Tyre.<s%> <S%H3213>Howl,<s%> ye <S%H591>ships<s%> of <S%H8659>Tarshish;<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> it is laid <S%H7703>waste,<s%> so that there is no <S%H4480>house,<s%> <S%H1004><s%> no entering <S%H4480>in:<s%> <S%H935><s%> from the <S%H4480>land<s%> <S%H776><s%> of <S%H3794>Chittim<s%> it is <S%H1540>revealed<s%> to them.

Be <S%H1826>still,<s%> ye <S%H3427>inhabitants<s%> of the <S%H339>isle;<s%> thou whom the <S%H5503>merchants<s%> of <S%H6721>Zidon,<s%> that pass <S%H5674>over<s%> the <S%H3220>sea,<s%> have <S%H4390>replenished.<s%>

And by <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H4325>waters<s%> the <S%H2233>seed<s%> of <S%H7883>Sihor,<s%> the <S%H7105>harvest<s%> of the <S%H2975>river,<s%> is her <S%H8393>revenue;<s%> and she <S%H1961>is<s%> a <S%H5505>mart<s%> of <S%H1471>nations.<s%>

Be thou <S%H954>ashamed,<s%> O <S%H6721>Zidon:<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> the <S%H3220>sea<s%> hath <S%H559>spoken,<s%> even the <S%H4581>strength<s%> of the <S%H3220>sea,<s%> <S%H559>saying,<s%> I <S%H2342>travail<s%> <S%H3808>not,<s%> <S%H3808>nor<s%> bring forth <S%H3205>children,<s%> <S%H3808>neither<s%> do I nourish <S%H1431>up<s%> young <S%H970>men,<s%> nor bring <S%H7311>up<s%> <S%H1330>virgins.<s%>
As <S%H834><s%> at the <S%H8088>report<s%> concerning <S%H4714>Egypt,<s%> so shall they be sorely <S%H2342>pained<s%> at the <S%H8088>report<s%> of <S%H6865>Tyre.<s%>
Pass ye <S%H5674>over<s%> to <S%H8659>Tarshish;<s%> <S%H3213>howl,<s%> ye <S%H3427>inhabitants<s%> of the <S%H339>isle.<s%>

Is <S%H2063>this<s%> your <S%H5947>joyous<s%> city, whose <S%H6927>antiquity<s%> is of <S%H6924>ancient<s%> <S%H4480>days?<s%> <S%H3117><s%> her own <S%H7272>feet<s%> shall <S%H2986>carry<s%> her afar <S%H4480>off<s%> <S%H7350><s%> to <S%H1481>sojourn.<s%>

Who <S%H4310><s%> hath taken this <S%H3289>counsel<s%> <S%H2063><s%> <S%H5921>against<s%> <S%H6865>Tyre,<s%> the <S%H5849>crowning<s%> city, <S%H834>whose<s%> <S%H5503>merchants<s%> are <S%H8269>princes,<s%> whose <S%H3669>traders<s%> are the <S%H3513>honorable<s%> of the <S%H776>earth?<s%>

The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> of <S%H6635>hosts<s%> hath <S%H3289>purposed<s%> it, to <S%H2490>stain<s%> the <S%H1347>pride<s%> of <S%H3605>all<s%> <S%H6643>glory,<s%> and to bring into <S%H7043>contempt<s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> the <S%H3513>honorable<s%> of the <S%H776>earth.<s%>
Pass <S%H5674>through<s%> thy <S%H776>land<s%> as a <S%H2975>river,<s%> O <S%H1323>daughter<s%> of <S%H8659>Tarshish:<s%> there is <S%H369>no<s%> <S%H5750>more<s%> <S%H4206>strength.<s%>

He stretched <S%H5186>out<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> <S%H5921>over<s%> the <S%H3220>sea,<s%> he <S%H7264>shook<s%> the <S%H4467>kingdoms:<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> hath given a <S%H6680>commandment<s%> <S%H413>against<s%> the <S%H3667>merchant<s%> city, to <S%H8045>destroy<s%> the <S%H4581>strongholds<s%> thereof.

And he <S%H559>said,<s%> Thou shalt <S%H3808>no<s%> <S%H5750>more<s%> <S%H5937>rejoice,<s%> O thou <S%H6231>oppressed<s%> <S%H1330>virgin,<s%> <S%H1323>daughter<s%> of <S%H6721>Zidon:<s%> <S%H6965>arise,<s%> pass <S%H5674>over<s%> to <S%H3794>Chittim;<s%> <S%H8033>there<s%> <S%H1571>also<s%> shalt thou have no <S%H5117>rest.<s%> <S%H3808><s%>

Behold <S%H2005><s%> the <S%H776>land<s%> of the <S%H3778>Chaldeans;<s%> <S%H2088>this<s%> <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H1961>was<s%> <S%H3808>not,<s%> till the <S%H804>Assyrian<s%> <S%H3245>founded<s%> it for them that dwell in the <S%H6728>wilderness:<s%> they set <S%H6965>up<s%> the <S%H971>towers<s%> thereof, they raised <S%H6209>up<s%> the <S%H759>palaces<s%> thereof; and he <S%H7760>brought<s%> it to <S%H4654>ruin.<s%>
Howl, <S%H3213><s%> ye <S%H591>ships<s%> of <S%H8659>Tarshish:<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> your <S%H4581>strength<s%> is laid <S%H7703>waste.<s%>

And it shall come to <S%H1961>pass<s%> in <S%H1931>that<s%> <S%H3117>day,<s%> that <S%H6865>Tyre<s%> shall be <S%H7911>forgotten<s%> <S%H7657>seventy<s%> <S%H8141>years,<s%> according to the <S%H3117>days<s%> of <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H4428>king:<s%> after the <S%H4480>end<s%> <S%H7093><s%> of <S%H7657>seventy<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> shall <S%H6865>Tyre<s%> <S%H7892>sing<s%> as a <S%H2181>harlot.<s%>

Take <S%H3947><s%> a <S%H3658>harp,<s%> go <S%H5437>about<s%> the <S%H5892>city,<s%> thou <S%H2181>harlot<s%> that hast been <S%H7911>forgotten;<s%> make <S%H3190>sweet<s%> <S%H5059>melody,<s%> sing <S%H7235>many<s%> <S%H7892>songs,<s%> <S%H4616>that<s%> thou mayest be <S%H2142>remembered.<s%>

And it shall come to <S%H1961>pass<s%> after the <S%H4480>end<s%> <S%H7093><s%> of <S%H7657>seventy<s%> <S%H8141>years,<s%> that the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> will <S%H6485>visit<s%> <S%H853><s%> <S%H6865>Tyre,<s%> and she shall <S%H7725>turn<s%> to her <S%H868>hire,<s%> and shall commit <S%H2181>fornication<s%> <S%H854>with<s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> the <S%H4467>kingdoms<s%> of the <S%H776>world<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> the <S%H6440>face<s%> of the <S%H127>earth.<s%>

And her <S%H5504>merchandise<s%> and her <S%H868>hire<s%> shall <S%H1961>be<s%> <S%H6944>holiness<s%> to the <S%H3068>LORD:<s%> it shall <S%H3808>not<s%> be <S%H686>treasured<s%> <S%H3808>nor<s%> laid <S%H2630>up;<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> her <S%H5504>merchandise<s%> shall <S%H1961>be<s%> for them that <S%H3427>dwell<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> to <S%H398>eat<s%> <S%H7654>sufficiently,<s%> and for <S%H6266>durable<s%> <S%H4374>clothing.<s%>
